inference:
The base of the pyramid is a square with side length $2$.
The area of the base is $2^2 = 4$.
The height of the pyramid is half the length of the diagonal of the face of the cube.
The diagonal of a face of the cube is $\sqrt{2^2 + 2^2} = \sqrt{8} = 2\sqrt{2}$.
The height of the pyramid is half of this, so the height is $\frac{2\sqrt{2}}{2} = \sqrt{2}$.
The volume of a pyramid is given by $\frac{1}{3} \times \text{area of base} \times \text{height}$.
So, the volume of the pyramid is $\frac{1}{3} \times 4 \times \sqrt{2} = \frac{4\sqrt{2}}{3}$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{4\sqrt{2}}{3}}$
